results.title: Glycaemic responses to metformin monotherapy by SNP clusters in patients with type 2 diabetes.
results.text_hl: CONCLUSION: These findings suggest that PRS derived from @<m>DISEASE_Insulinoma</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007340 @@@beta-cell dysfunction@@@ clusters may help predict glycaemic response to @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ and support the potential for genetically guided treatment in @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus_Type_2 @DISEASE_MESH:D003924 @@@T2D

results.title: Association of glycemia with insulin sensitivity and beta-cell function in adults with early type 2 diabetes on metformin alone.
results.text_hl: CONCLUSION: Glycemia is strongly associated with @<m>DISEASE_Insulinoma</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007340 @@@beta-cell dysfunction@@@ in adults with early @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus_Type_2 @DISEASE_MESH:D003924 @@@T2DM@@@ treated with @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ alone.

results.title: Anti-tumor potential of combinatory GSK3 inhibition in human 3D models of pancreatic neuroendocrine tumors and patient-derived GEP-NET primary cultures.
results.text_hl: Both agents show strong efficacy in a @SPECIES_9606 @@@patient@@@-derived @<m>DISEASE_Insulinoma</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007340 @@@insulinoma@@@ without affecting the corresponding normal pancreatic tissue.

results.title: Metformin: An Old Drug with New Applications
results.text_hl: This review therefore addresses the potential beneficial effects of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ on @DISEASE_Non_alcoholic_Fatty_Liver_Disease @DISEASE_MESH:D065626 @@@NAFLD@@@, its role in protecting against @DISEASE_Reperfusion_Injury @DISEASE_MESH:D015427 @@@cardiac ischemia-reperfusion@@@ (@DISEASE_Reperfusion_Injury @DISEASE_MESH:D015427 @@@I/R) injury@@@, @DISEASE_Atherosclerosis @DISEASE_MESH:D050197 @@@atherosclerosis@@@, glucotoxicity, and lipotoxicity induced oxidative and ER stress in pancreatic @<m>DISEASE_Insulinoma</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007340 @@@beta-cell dysfunction@@@, as well as its underlying molecular mechanisms of action.

results.title: Metformin attenuates hepatic insulin resistance in type-2 diabetic rats through PI3K/Akt/GLUT-4 signalling independent to bicuculline-sensitive GABAA receptor stimulation
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ also attenuated @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus_Type_2 @DISEASE_MESH:D003924 @@@T2DM@@@-induced hyperglycaemia (40%), hyperinsulinaemia (30%), @DISEASE_Insulin_Resistance @DISEASE_MESH:D007333 @@@insulin resistance@@@ (50%) and @<m>DISEASE_Insulinoma</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007340 @@@beta-cell dysfunction@@@ (300%) in the animals.

results.title: Restoring post-prandial insulin release in type 2 diabetes.
results.text_hl: Tight @CHEMICAL_Blood_Glucose @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001786 @@@blood glucose@@@ control is a primary aim of @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus_Type_2 @DISEASE_MESH:D003924 @@@type 2 diabetes@@@ treatment. Combining @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ with the amino acid derivative, @CHEMICAL_Nateglinide @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077715 @@@nateglinide@@@, tackles both @<m>DISEASE_Insulinoma</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007340 @@@beta cell dysfunction@@@ and @DISEASE_Insulin_Resistance @DISEASE_MESH:D007333 @@@insulin resistance@@@, and produces a greater decrease in haemoglobin A1c levels than treatment with either drug alone.

citations.NLM: Andrews J. Restoring post-prandial insulin release in type 2 diabetes. Hosp Med. 2002 Feb;63(2):95-8. PMID: 11902096
